channel.title: Comments on: Beyond Functional Programming with Elixir and Erlang
channel.description: Plataformatec's place to talk about Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, and software engineering

item.title: By: Santosh Kumar
item.dc:creator: Santosh Kumar
item.description: Great Post. So true. Erlang/Elixir is not Functional for Functional's sake - it's Functional because that makes the most sense given the problem it's trying to solve.
item.content:encoded: Great Post. So true. Erlang/Elixir is not Functional for Functional’s sake – it’s Functional because that makes the most sense given the problem it’s trying to solve.

item.title: By: Rohan Daxini
item.dc:creator: Rohan Daxini
item.description: Indeed interesting read and perspective about "purpose vs. means" to functional programming in the Erlang VM and thus Elixir. Thanks Jose :)
item.content:encoded: Indeed interesting read and perspective about “purpose vs. means” to functional programming in the Erlang VM and thus Elixir. Thanks Jose ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Tamori Hirofumi
item.dc:creator: Tamori Hirofumi
item.description: Very impressive. I agree there tend to be the paradoxical discussion in which people mistake the means for the purpose in functional programming. BTW, can I translate this blog into Japanese and reproduce it?
item.content:encoded: Very impressive. I agree there tend to be the paradoxical discussion in which people mistake the means for the purpose in functional programming. BTW, can I translate this blog into Japanese and reproduce it?
